snippet: European officials have warned Mexican and Canadian slaughterhouses that the meat of American racehorses may be too toxic to eat safely because of repeated drug injections.
abstract: European food safety officials warn Mexican and Canadian slaughterhouses that meat of American racehorses may be too toxic to eat because of repeated drug injections; officials indicate that they may require lifetime medication records for slaughter-bound horses from Canada and Mexico; action is latest sign of troubled state of American racing and its problems with doping horses.
lead_paragraph: European officials have warned Mexican and Canadian slaughterhouses that the meat of American racehorses may be too toxic to eat safely because of repeated drug injections.

headline.seo: Doping at U.S. Tracks Affects Europe’s Taste for Horse Meat
headline.main: Racetrack Drugs Put Europe Off U.S. Horse Meat
headline.print_headline: Drugs Injected at the Racetrack Put Europe Off U.S. Horse Meat
